metadata.dc:title: Adult spontaneous cerebrospinal fluid otorrhea. Report of two cases and review of the literature
metadata.dc:description: Introduction. Spontaneous cerebrospinal fluid otorrheais a relatively rare entity and can be easily missedin adults. Every adult older than 50 years with a negativehistory of otologic disease who has recurrent serousotitis media should be evaluated for this pathology.Meningitis is the most serious complication, so there isno doubt that the condition needs immediate attentionand correction.Objective. We present two patients who were diagnosedwith spontaneous CSF otorrhea and make areview of what is reported about this topic (..) (AU)
